DOC.brief_summary: This non-randomized , prospective , quasi-experimental study design assess impact pharmacist-provided medication management total cost care clinical outcome ( ie , hospitalization , emergency department visit ) real-world clinical practice .
DOC.detailed_description: Medication Management ( MTM ) Medication management define standard care ensure patient 's medication , include prescription , over-the-counter , herbal product , vitamin , supplement , individually assess determine follow : - Appropriateness medication patient - Effectiveness patient 's medical condition - Safety give patient 's co-morbidities medication - Convenience take patient intend Medication management service deliver individual patient fully integrated health care team achieve coordinate consistent patient care . Pharmacists provide service use standardized method comprehensively review patient 's medication . This systematic process design identify , prevent , resolve drug therapy problem aid attainment patient 's therapy goal . Medication management service include individualize care plan track progress intend goal therapy appropriate follow-up determine actual patient outcome . Pharmacists aim emphasize care experience patient , achieve good medication-related quality measure , reduce cost care . Patients enrol MTM group initial MTM visit , last approximately 60 minute . In visit , patient pharmacist discus medication ( prescription , over-the-counter , herbal ) patient take . Medications evaluate indication , efficacy , safety convenience . The pharmacist patient care team member participate share decision effort optimize patient clinical outcome medication experience . Patients continue work primary care provider care team member . Patients continue meet pharmacist individualize basis 1 year optimize patient ' medication base individual need . Patients enrol control group experience change medical care account enrol control group . They continue work primary care provider care team member .
DOC.criteria: MSSP patient , attribute Community Health Network Receive primary care HealthEast demonstrate > 2 outpatient visit one HealthEast 's primary care clinic 3 year prior enrollment . Currently take > 1 medication follow therapeutic class : antiplatelet/anticoagulant , hypoglycemic ( oral insulin ) , opioid analgesic Willingness subject work MTM pharmacist medication management throughout 12 month study period . Provided write informed consent Currently receive primary care nonHealthEast clinic Inpatient status Bethesda Hospital within last 12 month Currently receive hospice care In opinion investigator , kind disorder may compromise ability subject provide write informed consent
